intro: Horkelia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Horkelia parviflora thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
